entry.value: Name of the global result file (will be written inside the result folder)

Name of the global result file (will be written inside the result folder).%%00010%%00010The result file is a .csv in which each row provide information on a transformation (i.e. chemical reaction). For transformations producing several products, the transformation is described on several lines, one line per product. If a file already has the same name it will be deleted.%%00010%%00010Bellow information provided for each row/transformation:%%00010%%00010- Initial source: initial source compound(s) that have been used as starting point for the very first iteration. List of values surrounded by brackets, values are seperated by ", ".%%00010%%00010- Transformation ID: unique ID of the transformation (i.e. chemical reaction).%%00010%%00010- Reaction SMILES: description of the transformation using the reaction SMILES formalism.%%00010%%00010- Substrate SMILES: substrate structure provided as SMILES.%%00010%%00010- Substrate InChI: substrate structure provided as InChI.%%00010%%00010- Product SMILES: product structure provided as SMILES.%%00010%%00010- Product InChI: product structure provided as InChI.%%00010%%00010- In Sink: indicate wether a product structure correspond to one of those in the Sink. Possible value: 0 (not in Sink), 1 (in Sink).%%00010%%00010- Sink name: names or IDs of Sink compound(s) matching the product structure. List of values surrounded by brackets, values are seperated by ", ".%%00010%%00010- Diameter: diameter used for the transformation.%%00010%%00010- Rule ID: rule ID(s) corresponding to the transformation. List of values surrounded by brackets, values are seperated by ", ".%%00010%%00010- EC number: EC number(s) corresponding to the transformation. List of values surrounded by brackets, values are seperated by ", ".%%00010%%00010- Score: score associated to the transformation. Notice that the value should be considered as a penalty, i.e. the smaller is the better.%%00010%%00010- Iteration: iteration/step at which the transformation was found.
